TITLE: Thursday Briefing: Where is Gaza’s Aid?
DESCRIPTION: Also, sweeping U.S. climate regulations and the “3 Body Problem” on Netflix.
CONTENT: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak of Britain argues that flights to Rwanda would be a vital deterrent to immigration.

TITLE: Insooni Breaks Racial Barrier to Become Beloved Singer in South Korea
DESCRIPTION: Born to a South Korean mother and a Black American soldier, she rose to a pioneering stardom in a country that has long discriminated against biracial children.
CONTENT: Kim In-soon, known professionally as Insooni, taking a picture with a fan at a book signing in Seoul in March.

TITLE: A Look at Previous U.S. Vetoes of Gaza Cease-Fire Resolutions in the U.N.
DESCRIPTION: Before a U.S. resolution in the United Nations Security Council calling for a cease-fire in Gaza was vetoed on Friday, the U.S. had vetoed three previous ones demanding a halt to the fighting.
CONTENT: Linda Thomas-Greenfield, the U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, voted against a resolution calling for an immediate cease-fire last month.

TITLE: Vaughan Gething of Wales Is Europe’s First Black Head of Government
DESCRIPTION: Mr. Gething, 50, was narrowly elected leader of Wales’s governing Labour Party this week, and then was elected first minister by the Senedd, or Welsh Parliament.
CONTENT: Vaughan Gething poses for a photo, in a lecture hall at Cardiff University, after being elected as the next Welsh Labour leader and First Minister of Wales, in Cardiff, Saturday, March 16, 2024.

TITLE: Congress Seeks to Bar Funding for U.N. Agency for Palestinians
DESCRIPTION: A bill would bar support for the agency, UNRWA, amid accusations that some employees were Hamas fighters. Other countries are scrambling to make up the looming shortfall.
CONTENT: Palestinians gathered to receive aid outside an UNRWA warehouse in Gaza City on Monday.

TITLE: Indian Opposition Parties Say They Face Tide of Troubles as Vote Nears
DESCRIPTION: Weeks before pivotal elections, the head of one party was arrested on what his supporters said were trumped-up charges and another party said it lost access to its funds.
CONTENT: The leader of the Aam Aadmi Party, Arvind Kejriwal, was taken into custody late on Thursday at his home in New Delhi.

TITLE: What We Gained (and Lost) When Our Daughter Unplugged for a School Year
DESCRIPTION: My 13-year-old has left her phone behind for hiking, chores and study in the Australian wilderness. Our pen-and-paper correspondence is opening up an unexpected world.
CONTENT: Letters sent by the author’s daughter from Timbertop, a school campus in the Australian bush.

TITLE: Russian Missile Attack on Kyiv Leaves 10 Injured
DESCRIPTION: Ukraine said it had intercepted all 31 missiles fired at the capital. But debris injured at least 13 people and damaged several buildings.
CONTENT: Firefighters directing water onto a blaze on Thursday morning at the site of a missile strike in Kyiv, Ukraine.

TITLE: How the New E.P.A. Rules Affect Toyota and Their Hybrid Cars
DESCRIPTION: The auto giant lobbied hard against tougher pollution rules. This week, the E.P.A.’s new rules proved favorable to hybrid technology, an area that Toyota dominates.
CONTENT: Charging up in Lake Park, Fla.

TITLE: Rose Dugdale, Heiress Turned Irish Independence Fighter, Dies at 82
DESCRIPTION: Born into English wealth and Oxford-educated, she left it all behind for a life of radical and often violent activism.
CONTENT: Rose Dugdale in 1974 after being sentenced to nine years in prison for crimes including art theft. Born an English heiress, she left her wealth behind to join the Irish Republican Army.

TITLE: Uganda President Museveni Appoints His Son as Top Army Commander
DESCRIPTION: Gen. Muhoozi Kainerugaba, who has a reputation for provocative late-night tweets, has been working to position himself as heir apparent to his father, President Yoweri Museveni.
CONTENT: Gen. Muhoozi Kainerugaba, the son of Uganda’s president, has been working to raise his profile and set himself up as heir apparent.

TITLE: As Americans Flee Haiti, 2-Year-Old Is Separated from His Parents
DESCRIPTION: The boy had been dropped off with relatives nearly three weeks ago and was airlifted back to his Florida home. He is part of a growing number of Americans trying to flee Haiti.
CONTENT: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken arriving in Cairo on Thursday to discuss the war in Gaza with Mideast leaders.

TITLE: The Deadly Moscow Concert Hall Attack in Photos
DESCRIPTION: Images show the scene of what could be the deadliest attack in Russia in decades. Multiple gunmen killed at least 40 people in an assault in the capital’s outskirts.
CONTENT: Crocus City Hall in Moscow on fire Friday night after a major attack.

TITLE: Doctors, Back From Gaza Hospitals, Tell Congress of Horrors Amid Cease-Fire Push
DESCRIPTION: Volunteers who treated patients in harrowing conditions lobbied American officials on the urgency of an immediate cease-fire.

TITLE: Ireland’s Prime Minister, Leo Varadkar, Resigned. What Happens Now?
DESCRIPTION: Leo Varadkar, the prime minister of the Republic of Ireland, resigned unexpectedly, prompting a political scramble. Here’s what to know about what happens next.
CONTENT: Ireland’s prime minister, Leo Varadkar, at a European Council summit in Brussels on Thursday, a day after he said he would step down.

TITLE: A Mexican Drug Cartel Targets Retirees and Their Timeshares
DESCRIPTION: One of Mexico’s most violent criminal groups, Jalisco New Generation, runs call centers that offer to buy retirees’ vacation properties. Then, it empties its victims’ bank accounts.
CONTENT: Tourists in Puerto Vallarta, a popular beach town in Mexico, in February. Over the last five years, American timeshare owners were bilked out of $288 million, according to the F.B.I.

TITLE: Blinken Meets With Netanyahu at Moment of Tension Between U.S. and Israel
DESCRIPTION: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu repeated that Israel was determined to send troops into the crowded southern Gaza city of Rafah despite U.S. urgings not to.
CONTENT: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken arrived in Tel Aviv for meetings with Israeli officials on Friday.

TITLE: Norman Miller, German Refugee Who Helped Arrest a Top Nazi, Dies at 99
DESCRIPTION: At 15, he escaped to England. At 20, he enlisted in the British Army and identified a German minister — whose roles included deporting Dutch Jews to labor camps — as he tried to flee.
CONTENT: Striking workers added wood to a fire to stay warm during evening shifts in front of a recycling plant owned by the company SRW in Rötha, Germany, on Wednesday.

TITLE: Collecting the Dead Russia Left Behind
DESCRIPTION: Civilians who gather dead Russian soldiers face many of the war’s perils along the front, where death is ubiquitous.
CONTENT: A drone photograph showing Russian soldiers killed on the battlefield on the front line of eastern Ukraine.

TITLE: U.S. Warned About Possible Moscow Attack Before Concert Hall Shooting

CONTENT: The U.S. Embassy in Moscow issued a warning about possible attacks on large gatherings, including concerts, on March 7.

TITLE: The A.I. Boom Makes Millions for an Unlikely Industry Player: Anguilla
DESCRIPTION: The small Caribbean territory brought in $32 million last year, more than 10 percent of its G.D.P., from companies registering web addresses that end in .ai.
CONTENT: For each domain registration, Anguilla’s government gets anywhere from $140 to thousands of dollars from website names sold at auctions.

TITLE: Thursday Briefing
DESCRIPTION: The E.U.’s plan to make Russia pay to arm Ukraine.
CONTENT: A Ukrainian armored vehicle near Bakhmut in eastern Ukraine, last month. Soldiers on the front lines are reporting shortages of ammunition.

CONTENT: President Biden traveled to Israel and met with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu days after the Oct. 7 attack.

TITLE: Why Do Autocrats Like Putin Bother to Hold Elections?
DESCRIPTION: These votes can demonstrate control, serve as a warning and create the illusion of accountability.
CONTENT: The visage of President Vladimir V. Putin was part of the stage at a celebration in Red Square after his “re-election.”

TITLE: Iceland’s Tourism Suffers Amid a Belching Volcano and Flowing Lava
